availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Pascal G. Bryant (Laurel County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Laurel County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Adkins Bryant in Campbell County, Tennessee, on March 15, 1838. Father of William T. Bryant, Sophrona T. Bryant, Thomas Bryant, Elizabeth Bryant, Susan Bryant, William S. Bryant, John P. Bryant, Ann Bryant, and Asley Bryant. Farmer in Knox County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Laurel County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861, to January 10, 1862. Reported deserted from Fayette County, Kentucky, on January 10, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, p. 323A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, p. 433.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Campbell County, 1838 - 1889: Marriages 3, p. 234.
“Bryant, Paschal,” Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 365.
